alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 13 at 9:34AM MDT until April 19 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Glasgow MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Malta affecting Central and Southeast Phillips zone. .Warm temperatures may melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Malta...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Milk River at Malta. * WHEN...From Friday evening to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Campground near US 2 bridge begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 545 PM MDT.
